availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Harrison County on July 5, 1824. Attended Center College in Danville, Kentucky. Graduated Law School at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Admitted to the Bar in 1844. Moved to Memphis, Tennessee for a short time and then returned to Harrison County where he practiced law until being elected to the Harrison Circuit Court in 1856. He served as a Judge in the Harrison Circuit Court until 1862. Died in Cynthiana on August 5, 1888.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "Judge John Strother Boyd (July 5, 1824 - August 6, 1888)," Memorial #43076115, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=43076115&ref=acom (accessed June 9, 2017); "Judge Boyd Dead," Harrison County Courier (Cynthiana, Kentucky), August 11, 1888; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison, District 1, p. 432; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison, Cynthiana, p. 372.
